file_content.text: The Sith War Memorial Garden is just beyond our outpost. Good luck.
General Hesker wants a word.
The rebels are massing at the Sith War Memorial Garden--a pit honoring Jedi scum who fell to our first invasion three hundred years ago.
Naturally that's where the Republic base lies. Guarded by battle droids, Jedi and a battalion of their best shock troops. You name the weapon, they've aimed it our way.
The rebels are following orders. Break their commander, and we'll crush their resistance.
We must strike their leader.
A wise strategy, my lord. We've been tracking such a man. Lieutenant, his profile....
Someone's responsible for this mess. We must enslave him to our will.
Break their leader.
There is such a man, my lord. But he won't break easily. Lieutenant, his profile...
Make whoever's orchestrating this defense disappear.
Eliminate their leader.
Indeed. We've been tracking such a man. Lieutenant, his profile...
Someone's in charge. If you want me to drop him, give me the details.
You need the leader gone.
Very good. We've been following their commander for some time. Lieutenant, his profile....
These rebels must have some weakness.
So what's the good news?
Perhaps only that they rely too heavily on one man--who should be our primary. The lieutenant has his profile.
Perfect stage for a massacre.
You'll have plenty of hostiles to eliminate--but focus on their commander. Lieutenant, you have his profile.
Yes, sir. Master Corin Tok. A Zabrak Jedi Knight, Republic war hero... and veteran of the Sacking of Coruscant.
One of the few survivors. Many Sith fell to his lightsaber that day. He earned himself a pretty little reputation.
Survivors claimed he was invincible. Blaster bolts splashing off skin, lightsabers failing in his presence. I say it's that special armor under his robes.
Since then, Master Corin Tok has aged into a hardened warhorse; his myth has grown, and he stands between us and control of Axial Park.
Corellia's future lies with the Empire. No Jedi will prevent that.
Axial Park will be ours.
We will attack at once. You'll have the full support of the Imperial military.
Legends like that carry heavy bounties. Leave him to me.
He sounds like a worthy prize.
I knew you'd recognize the benefits, hunter. Eliminate him, and the Empire will reward your troubles.
A mere Jedi doesn't scare me.
Glad to hear it.
There's a chance I could help.
I can't delay our assault. I hope you'll lead the charge.
Lieutenant, order your men to strike the Memorial Garden. Hit every monument--erase all signs of the Republic's past victory.
I need you to spearhead the attack. Storm the Republic base and bury the Jedi Master. We take Axial Park now!
Thank goodness it's you, my lord. It's madness--artillery blasts, Republic troops everywhere. I thought we were finished!
Thank you for the assist, sir! It's madness out there. The Republic hit us hard... I was sure we were goners!
A mercenary... and one of ours! Thank goodness! We're low on reserves, and the Republic won't stop hammering us!
I can't believe you made it. The Republic hit us... most of my men are dead... I wasn't trained for this!
Control your fear, Lieutenant, or I'll control it for you.
Focus yourself.
Understood, my lord. General Hesker... he awaits an audience with you.
You're an Imperial soldier, not a child. Act like it!
Pull yourself together.
My apologies, sir.... I was supposed to tell you--General Hesker wants a word.
You Imps need to learn how to stay calm.
Pull yourself together.
You're right. I'm sorry. General Hesker wants a word.
Contact Imperial Command. This battle's not over yet.
Connect me to General Hesker.
Of course... I'll put you through at once.
You're pathetic, Lieutenant.
I'm sorry. General Hesker wants a word. Please don't mention this.
Good work out there. Darbin's met his rebel contact, Axial Park's covered with Republic casualties. But they're not retreating yet.
This is our last outpost before the Memorial Garden. We tried to advance, but it's no use.
